intro: Cheilotheca humilis var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy cheilotheca, is a low-growing perennial plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves. The plant typically produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
